com.pranavpandey.android.dynamic.utils

Class DynamicColorUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pranavpandey.android.dynamic.utils.DynamicColorUtils

  • public class DynamicColorUtils
extends Object
    Helper class to change colors dynamically.

    • Method Detail

      • getTintColor

        public static int getTintColor(int color)
        Calculate tint based on a given color for better readability.
        Parameters:
        color - Color whose tint to be calculated.
        Returns:
        Tint of the given color.

      • getStateColor

        public static int getStateColor(int color,
                                float light,
                                float dark)
        Lightens or darkens a color by a given amount.
        Parameters:
        color - The color to be lighten or darken.
        light - The amount to lighten the color. 0 will leave the color unchanged. 1 will make the color completely white.
        dark - The amount to darken the color. 0 will leave the color unchanged. 1 will make the color completely black.
        Returns:
        The lighter color.

      • getLighterColor

        public static int getLighterColor(int color,
                                  float amount)
        Lightens a color by a given amount.
        Parameters:
        color - The color to lighten.
        amount - The amount to lighten the color. 0 will leave the color unchanged. 1 will make the color completely white.
        Returns:
        The lighter color.

      • getDarkerColor

        public static int getDarkerColor(int color,
                                 float amount)
        Darkens a color by a given amount.
        Parameters:
        color - The color to darken.
        amount - The amount to darken the color. 0 will leave the color unchanged. 1 will make the color completely black.
        Returns:
        The darker color.

      • getAccentColor

        public static int getAccentColor(int color)
        Calculate accent color based on the given color for android theme generation. Still in beta so, sometimes may be inaccurate colors.
        Parameters:
        color - Color whose accent color to be calculated.
        Returns:
        Accent color based on the given color.

      • getRandomColor

        public static int getRandomColor()
        Generate a random rgb color.
        Returns:
        The randomly generated color.
        See Also:
        Random, Color.HSVToColor(float[])

      • getRandomColor

        public static int getRandomColor(int color)
        Generate a random rgb color by comparing a given color.
        Parameters:
        color - The color to compare.
        Returns:
        The randomly generated color.

      • getContrastColor

        public static int getContrastColor(int color,
                                   int contrastWith)
        Calculate contrast of a color based on the given base color so that it will be visible always on top of the base color.
        Parameters:
        color - Color whose contrast to be calculated.
        contrastWith - Background color to calculate the contrast.
        Returns:
        Contrast of the given color according to the base color.

      • isColorDark

        public static boolean isColorDark(int color)
        Detect light or dark color.
        Parameters:
        color - Color whose darkness to be calculated.
        Returns:
        true if color is dark.

      • getColorDarkness

        public static double getColorDarkness(int color)
        Calculate darkness of a color.
        Parameters:
        color - Color whose darkness to be calculated.
        Returns:
        Darkness of color (less that or equal to 1); 0 for white and 1 for black.

      • calculateContrast

        public static float calculateContrast(int color1,
                                      int color2)
        Calculate color contrast difference between two colors based on luma value according to XYZ color space.
        Parameters:
        color1 - First color to calculate the contrast difference.
        color2 - Second color to calculate the contrast difference.
        Returns:
        Color contrast between the two colors.
        See Also:
        calculateXyzLuma(int)

      • shiftColor

        public static int shiftColor(int color,
                             float by)
        Shift a color according to the given parameter. Useful to create different color states.
        Parameters:
        color - Color to be shifted.
        by - Factor in float by which shift the color.
        Returns:
        Shifted color.

      • getLessVisibleColor

        public static int getLessVisibleColor(int color)
        Calculate less visible color of a given color. Useful to create unselected or disabled color states.
        Parameters:
        color - Color whose less visible color to be calculated.
        Returns:
        Less visible color by shifting the color.

      • adjustAlpha

        public static int adjustAlpha(int color,
                              float factor)
        Adjust alpha of a color according to the given parameter.
        Parameters:
        color - Color whose alpha to be adjusted.
        factor - Factor in float by which adjust the alpha.
        Returns:
        Color with adjusted alpha.

      • removeAlpha

        public static int removeAlpha(int color)
        Remove alpha from a color.
        Parameters:
        color - Color whose alpha to be removed.
        Returns:
        Color without alpha.

      • getColorString

        public static String getColorString(int color,
                                    boolean includeAlpha,
                                    boolean includeHash)
        Get hexadecimal string from the color integer.
        Parameters:
        color - Color to get the hex code.
        includeAlpha - true to include alpha in the string.
        includeHash - true to include # in the string.
        Returns:
        Hexadecimal string equivalent of the supplied color integer.
